InterestingFact: India is the world’s largest democracy and home to the Taj Mahal, one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
The U.S. has the world’s largest economy and is home to the Grand Canyon, one of the seven natural wonders.
China’s Great Wall is the longest man-made structure in the world.
Japan is made up of over 6,800 islands and is famous for its cherry blossoms.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which produces about 20% of the world’s oxygen.
Australia is the only continent covered by a single country.
Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world combined.
Germany is famous for its Autobahn highways which have stretches with no speed limits.
France is the most visited country in the world.
The UK is made up of four countries: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland.
Rome is home to Vatican City, the smallest country in the world.
Russia is the largest country in the world, spanning 11 time zones.
South Africa has three capital cities, each serving a different function.
Egypt is home to the Pyramids of Giza, the last surviving wonder of the ancient world.
Mexico introduced chocolate, chilies, and corn to the world.
Argentina is the birthplace of tango music and dance.
Spain produces over half of the world’s olive oil.
South Korea is one of the most wired countries in the world with super-fast internet speeds.
Istanbul, Turkey’s largest city, is the only city in the world that spans two continents.
Indonesia is made up of over 17,000 islands, making it the world’s largest archipelago.
